penguins.name: Emperor Penguin
penguins.desc: The emperor penguin is the tallest and heaviest of all living penguin species and is endemic to Antarctica.

penguins.name: Adélie Penguin
penguins.desc: The Adélie penguin is a species of penguin common along the entire coast of the Antarctic continent, which is the only place where it is found.

penguins.name: Australian Little Penguin
penguins.desc: The Australian little penguin, also called the fairy penguin, is a species of penguin from Australia and the Otago region of New Zealand

penguins.name: Humboldt Penguin
penguins.desc: The Humboldt penguin is a medium-sized penguin. It resides in South America, its range mainly contains most of coastal Peru.

penguins.name: Yellow-eyed Penguin
penguins.desc: The yellow-eyed penguin, known also as hoiho or tarakaka, is a species of penguin endemic to New Zealand.

penguins.name: Erect-crested Penguin
penguins.desc: The erect-crested penguin is a penguin endemic to the New Zealand region
